name: forme
doc: Package forme provides a high-performance terminal UI framework.

types.name: Align
types.doc: Align specifies text alignment within a cell.
types.decl: type Align uint8

types.name: App
types.doc: App is a TUI application with integrated input handling via riffkey.

constructors.name: NewApp
constructors.doc: NewApp creates a new TUI application (fullscreen, alternate buffer).

constructors.name: NewInlineApp
constructors.doc:
NewInlineApp creates a new inline TUI application.
Inline apps render at the current cursor position without taking over the screen.
Use this for progress bars, selection menus, spinners, etc.

methods.name: AddJumpTarget
methods.doc:
AddJumpTarget registers a jump target during rendering.
Called by Jump components when jump mode is active.
methods.signature: func (a *App) AddJumpTarget(x, y int16, onSelect func(), style Style)

methods.name: Back
methods.doc:
Back returns to the previous view.
Currently an alias for Pop() - may add history later.

methods.name: BindField
methods.doc: BindField routes unmatched keys to a text input field.

methods.name: ClearOnExit
methods.doc:
ClearOnExit sets whether the inline app should clear its content on exit.
If true, the rendered content disappears when the app stops.
If false (default), the content remains visible and cursor moves below it.

methods.name: Cursor
methods.doc: Cursor returns the current cursor state.

methods.name: EnterJumpMode
methods.doc:
EnterJumpMode activates jump label mode.
A render is triggered to collect jump targets, then a temporary router
is pushed to handle label input.

methods.name: ExitJumpMode
methods.doc: ExitJumpMode deactivates jump label mode.

methods.name: Go
methods.doc:
Go switches to a different view.
Swaps the template and input handlers.

methods.name: Handle
methods.doc:
Handle registers a key binding with a vim-style pattern.
Examples: "j", "gg", "<C-c>", "<C-w>j", "<Up>"
Accepts func(riffkey.Match), func(any), or func() for convenience.
Automatically requests a re-render after the handler runs.

methods.name: HandleNamed
methods.doc:
HandleNamed registers a named key binding (for rebinding support).
Automatically requests a re-render after the handler runs.
methods.signature: func (a *App) HandleNamed(name, pattern string, handler func(riffkey.Match)) *App

methods.name: Height
methods.doc:
Height sets the height for inline apps.
This determines how many lines the inline view will use.
If not set, defaults to 1.

methods.name: HideCursor
methods.doc: HideCursor hides the cursor.

methods.name: Input
methods.doc: Input returns the riffkey input for modal handling (push/pop).

methods.name: IsInline
methods.doc: IsInline returns true if this is an inline app.

methods.name: JumpKey
methods.doc:
JumpKey registers a key pattern to trigger jump mode.
This is a convenience method that calls EnterJumpMode when the key is pressed.

methods.name: JumpMode
methods.doc: JumpMode returns the jump mode state for use during rendering.

methods.name: JumpModeActive
methods.doc: JumpModeActive returns true if jump mode is currently active.

methods.name: JumpStyle
methods.doc: JumpStyle returns the current jump style.

methods.name: OnAfterRender
methods.doc:
OnAfterRender sets a callback to be called after each render completes.
Use this to update cursor position after layout is known.

methods.name: OnBeforeRender
methods.doc:
OnBeforeRender sets a callback to be called before each render.
Use this to sync state (e.g., filter updates) before layout runs.

methods.name: OnResize
methods.doc:
OnResize sets a callback to be called when the terminal is resized.
The callback receives the new width and height.
Use this to update viewport dimensions, reinitialize layers, etc.

methods.name: Pop
methods.doc: Pop pops the current router from the input stack.

methods.name: PopView
methods.doc:
PopView removes the top modal overlay.
Returns to the previous view in the stack.

methods.name: Push
methods.doc: Push pushes a new router onto the input stack (for modal input).

methods.name: PushView
methods.doc:
PushView pushes a view as a modal overlay.
The modal's handlers take precedence until PopView() is called.
The pushed view becomes the active rendered view until popped.

methods.name: RenderNow
methods.doc:
RenderNow performs a render immediately without channel coordination.
Use this from dedicated update goroutines to avoid scheduler overhead.
The render is mutex-protected so it's safe to call concurrently.

methods.name: RequestRender
methods.doc:
RequestRender marks that a render is needed.
Safe to call from any goroutine.

methods.name: Router
methods.doc: Router returns the riffkey router for advanced configuration.

methods.name: Run
methods.doc:
Run starts the application. Blocks until Stop is called.
For multi-view apps, use RunFrom(startView) instead.

methods.name: RunFrom
methods.doc:
RunFrom starts the application on the specified view.
Use this for multi-view apps.

methods.name: RunNonInteractive
methods.doc:
RunNonInteractive runs an inline app without an input loop.
Use this for progress bars, spinners, etc. that don't need keyboard input.
Call Stop() when done to clean up and exit.

methods.name: Screen
methods.doc: Screen returns the screen.

methods.name: SetCursor
methods.doc:
SetCursor sets the cursor position (0-indexed screen coordinates).
The cursor will be positioned here after each render.

methods.name: SetCursorColor
methods.doc:
SetCursorColor sets the cursor color using OSC 12 escape sequence.
This changes the actual cursor color in supporting terminals.

methods.name: SetCursorStyle
methods.doc: SetCursorStyle sets the cursor visual style.

methods.name: SetJumpStyle
methods.doc: SetJumpStyle sets the global style for jump labels.

methods.name: SetView
SetViewLimit
methods.doc:
SetViewLimit sets the maximum number of times SetView can be called.
Panics if exceeded. Use this to catch anti-patterns where SetView is called
repeatedly instead of using reactive updates via pointers.

Example:

	app.SetViewLimit(1) // Panic if SetView called more than once
	app.SetView(myView) // OK
	app.SetView(other)  // PANIC: SetView called 2 times, limit is 1

Set to 0 (default) for unlimited calls.

methods.name: ShowCursor
methods.doc: ShowCursor makes the cursor visible.

methods.name: Size
methods.doc: Size returns the current screen size.

methods.name: Stop
methods.doc: Stop signals the application to stop.

methods.name: Template
methods.doc:
Template returns the current template for debugging.
Use with Template().DebugDump("") to inspect the op tree.

methods.name: UnbindField
methods.doc: UnbindField clears the text input field binding.

methods.name: UpdateView
methods.doc:
UpdateView recompiles a view with a new view definition.
Use this when the view's structure changes and needs re-compilation.

methods.name: View
methods.doc:
View registers a named view for multi-view routing.
Returns a builder for chaining Handle() calls.

Example:

	app.View("home", homeView).
	    Handle("j", moveDown).
	    Handle("s", func(_ riffkey.Match) { app.Go("settings") })

methods.name: ViewRouter
methods.doc:
ViewRouter returns the router for a named view, if it exists.
Useful for advanced configuration like HandleUnmatched.

types.name: Attribute
types.doc: Attribute represents text styling attributes that can be combined.
types.decl: type Attribute uint8

methods.name: Has
methods.doc: Has returns true if the attribute set contains the given attribute.

methods.name: With
methods.doc: With returns a new attribute set with the given attribute added.

methods.name: Without
methods.doc: Without returns a new attribute set with the given attribute removed.

consts.decl:
const (
	AttrNone Attribute = 0
	AttrBold Attribute = 1 << iota
	AttrDim
	AttrItalic
	AttrUnderline
	AttrBlink
	AttrInverse
	AttrStrikethrough
)

types.name: AutoTableC

constructors.name: AutoTable
constructors.doc:
AutoTable creates a table from a slice of structs.
Pass a slice like []MyStruct or []*MyStruct.

methods.name: BindNav
methods.doc:
BindNav registers key bindings for scrolling down/up by one row.
the closures capture the scroll pointer and data pointer, reading the
current slice length at invocation time for correct clamping.
methods.signature: func (t AutoTableC) BindNav(down, up string) AutoTableC

methods.name: BindPageNav
methods.doc: BindPageNav registers key bindings for page-sized scrolling.
methods.signature: func (t AutoTableC) BindPageNav(pageDown, pageUp string) AutoTableC

methods.name: BindVimNav
methods.doc:
BindVimNav wires standard vim-style scroll keys:
j/k for line, Ctrl-d/Ctrl-u for page.

methods.name: Column
methods.doc:
Column configures rendering for a specific column by struct field name.
The option can be a canned preset or a custom function:

	AutoTable(&data).
	    Column("Price", Currency("$", 2)).
	    Column("Change", PercentChange(1)).
	    Column("Active", func(c *ColumnConfig) {
	        c.Align(AlignCenter)
	        c.Format(func(v any) string { ... })
	    })
methods.signature: func (t AutoTableC) Column(name string, opt ColumnOption) AutoTableC

methods.name: Columns
methods.doc:
Columns selects which struct fields to display and in what order.
Field names are case-sensitive and must match exported struct fields.

methods.name: Headers
methods.doc:
Headers sets custom header labels for the columns.
Must be called after Columns() and have the same number of entries.

methods.name: MarginTRBL
methods.signature: func (t AutoTableC) MarginTRBL(a, b, c, d int16) AutoTableC

methods.name: MarginVH
methods.signature: func (t AutoTableC) MarginVH(v, h int16) AutoTableC

methods.name: Scrollable
methods.doc:
Scrollable enables viewport scrolling with the given maximum visible rows.
renders all data rows to an internal buffer, blits only the visible window.

methods.name: Sortable
methods.doc:
Sortable enables column sorting via jump labels.
when the app's jump key is pressed, each column header becomes a jump target.
selecting a column sorts ascending; selecting the same column again toggles direction.

types.name: BorderStyle
types.doc: BorderStyle defines the characters used for drawing borders.
types.decl:
type BorderStyle struct {
	Horizontal  rune
	Vertical    rune
	TopLeft     rune
	TopRight    rune
	BottomLeft  rune
	BottomRight rune
}

types.name: Box
types.doc:
Box is a container with a custom layout function.
Use this when HBox/VBox don't fit your needs.

types.name: Buffer
types.doc: Buffer is a 2D grid of cells representing a drawable surface.

constructors.name: NewBuffer
constructors.doc: NewBuffer creates a new buffer with the given dimensions.

methods.name: Blit
methods.doc:
Blit copies a rectangular region from src buffer to this buffer.
srcX, srcY: top-left corner in source buffer (for scrolling)
dstX, dstY: top-left corner in destination buffer
width, height: size of region to copy
Uses optimized row-by-row copy() for speed.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) Blit(src *Buffer, srcX, srcY, dstX, dstY, width, height int)

methods.name: Clear
methods.doc:
Clear clears the buffer to empty cells with default style.
Uses copy() from a cached empty buffer for speed (memmove vs scalar loop).

methods.name: ClearDirty
methods.doc:
ClearDirty clears only the rows that were written to since last clear.
Much faster than Clear() when content doesn't fill the buffer.

methods.name: ClearDirtyFlags
methods.doc:
ClearDirtyFlags resets all row dirty flags after a flush.
Call this after Screen.Flush() to start tracking changes for next frame.

methods.name: ClearLine
methods.doc: ClearLine clears a single line to empty cells.

methods.name: ClearLineWithStyle
methods.doc: ClearLineWithStyle clears a single line with a styled space cell.

methods.name: ContentHeight
methods.doc: ContentHeight returns the number of rows that have been written to.

methods.name: CopyFrom
methods.doc:
CopyFrom copies all cells from src to b using a single bulk copy.
Requires both buffers to have identical dimensions.
This is much faster than cell-by-cell copy for full-buffer transfers.

methods.name: DrawBorder
methods.doc: DrawBorder draws a border around the given rectangle.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) DrawBorder(x, y, width, height int, border BorderStyle, style Style)

methods.name: DrawPanel
methods.doc:
DrawPanel draws a bordered panel with title and returns the interior region.
Title appears in the top border: ┌─ TITLE ─────┐
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) DrawPanel(x, y, w, h int, title string, style Style) *Region

methods.name: DrawPanelEx
methods.doc: DrawPanelEx draws a panel with custom border style.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) DrawPanelEx(x, y, w, h int, title string, border BorderStyle, style Style) *Region

methods.name: Fill
methods.doc: Fill fills the entire buffer with the given cell.

methods.name: FillRect
methods.doc:
FillRect fills a rectangular region with the given cell.
Uses direct slice writes (no border merge) for non-border cells,
falls back to Set() only when the cell is a border character.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) FillRect(x, y, width, height int, c Cell)

methods.name: Get
methods.doc:
Get returns the cell at the given coordinates.
Returns an empty cell if out of bounds.

methods.name: GetLine
methods.doc: GetLine returns the content of a single line as a string (trimmed).

methods.name: GetLineStyled
methods.doc: GetLineStyled returns a line with embedded ANSI escape codes for styles.

methods.name: HLine
methods.doc: HLine draws a horizontal line of the given rune.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) HLine(x, y, length int, r rune, style Style)

methods.name: Height
methods.doc: Height returns the buffer height.

methods.name: InBounds
methods.doc: InBounds returns true if the given coordinates are within the buffer.

methods.name: MarkAllDirty
methods.doc:
MarkAllDirty forces all rows to be considered dirty.
Useful after external modifications or for testing.

methods.name: Region
methods.doc: Region creates a view into a rectangular region of the buffer.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) Region(x, y, width, height int) *Region

methods.name: ResetDirtyMax
methods.doc:
ResetDirtyMax resets the dirty tracking without clearing content.
Use when you know the template will overwrite all cells.

methods.name: Resize
methods.doc:
Resize resizes the buffer to new dimensions.
Existing content is preserved where it fits.

methods.name: RowDirty
methods.doc:
RowDirty returns true if the given row has been modified since last ClearDirtyFlags.
If allDirty is set (after Clear/Resize), all rows are considered dirty.

methods.name: Set
methods.doc:
Set sets the cell at the given coordinates.
Does nothing if out of bounds.
When drawing border characters, automatically merges with existing borders.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) Set(x, y int, c Cell)

methods.name: SetFast
methods.doc:
SetFast sets a cell without border merging. Use for text/progress where
you know the content isn't a border character.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) SetFast(x, y int, c Cell)

methods.name: SetRune
methods.doc: SetRune sets just the rune at the given coordinates, preserving style.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) SetRune(x, y int, r rune)

methods.name: SetStyle
methods.doc: SetStyle sets just the style at the given coordinates, preserving rune.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) SetStyle(x, y int, s Style)

methods.name: Size
methods.doc: Size returns the buffer dimensions.

methods.name: String
methods.doc:
String returns the buffer contents as a string (for testing/debugging).
Each row is separated by a newline. Trailing spaces are preserved.

methods.name: StringTrimmed
methods.doc: StringTrimmed returns the buffer contents with trailing spaces removed per line.

methods.name: VLine
methods.doc: VLine draws a vertical line of the given rune.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) VLine(x, y, length int, r rune, style Style)

methods.name: Width
methods.doc: Width returns the buffer width.

methods.name: WriteLeader
methods.doc:
WriteLeader writes "Label.....Value" format with fill characters.
The label is left-aligned, value is right-aligned, fill chars in between.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteLeader(x, y int, label, value string, width int, fill rune, style Style)

methods.name: WriteProgressBar
methods.doc:
WriteProgressBar writes a progress bar directly to the buffer.
Uses partial block characters for smooth sub-character precision.
Background color fills the empty space for seamless appearance.
Batch write - much faster than per-cell Set calls.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteProgressBar(x, y, width int, ratio float32, style Style)

methods.name: WriteSpans
methods.doc:
WriteSpans writes multiple styled text spans sequentially.
Each span has its own style. Spans are written left to right.
Handles double-width CJK characters correctly.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteSpans(x, y int, spans []Span, maxWidth int)

methods.name: WriteSparkline
methods.doc: WriteSparkline writes a sparkline chart using Unicode block characters.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteSparkline(x, y int, values []float64, width int, min, max float64, style Style)

methods.name: WriteString
methods.doc:
WriteString writes a string at the given coordinates with the given style.
Returns the number of cells written.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteString(x, y int, s string, style Style) int

methods.name: WriteStringClipped
methods.doc:
WriteStringClipped writes a string, stopping at maxWidth.
Returns the number of cells written.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteStringClipped(x, y int, s string, style Style, maxWidth int) int

methods.name: WriteStringFast
methods.doc:
WriteStringFast writes a string without border merging.
Direct slice access for maximum speed.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteStringFast(x, y int, s string, style Style, maxWidth int)

methods.name: WriteStringPadded
methods.doc:
WriteStringPadded writes a string and pads with spaces to fill width.
This allows skipping Clear() when UI structure is stable.
methods.signature: func (b *Buffer) WriteStringPadded(x, y int, s string, style Style, width int)

types.name: BufferPool
types.doc:
BufferPool manages double-buffered rendering.
Swap alternates between two buffers, clearing the inactive one
synchronously before making it current.

constructors.name: NewBufferPool
constructors.doc: NewBufferPool creates a double-buffered pool.

methods.name: Current
methods.doc: Current returns the current buffer for rendering.

methods.name: Height
methods.doc: Height returns the buffer height.

methods.name: Resize
methods.doc:
Resize resizes both buffers in the pool to new dimensions.
Call this when the terminal is resized.

methods.name: Run
methods.doc:
Run executes a render loop until ctx is cancelled.
Each frame the callback receives a pre-cleared buffer - do whatever you need with it.
methods.signature: func (p *BufferPool) Run(ctx context.Context, frame func(buf *Buffer)) error

methods.name: Stop
methods.doc: Stop is a no-op kept for API compatibility.

methods.name: Swap
methods.doc:
Swap switches to the other buffer.
Returns the new current buffer (cleared and ready to use).

methods.name: Width
methods.doc: Width returns the buffer width.

types.name: Cell
types.doc: Cell represents a single character cell on the terminal.

constructors.name: EmptyCell
constructors.doc: EmptyCell returns a cell with a space and default style.

constructors.name: NewCell
constructors.doc: NewCell creates a cell with the given rune and style.
constructors.signature: func NewCell(r rune, style Style) Cell

methods.name: Equal
methods.doc: Equal returns true if two cells are equal.

types.name: CheckListC
types.doc: CheckListC is a list with per-item checkboxes, similar to todo lists.

constructors.name: CheckList
constructors.doc: CheckList creates a list where each item has a checkbox.

methods.name: BindVimNav
methods.doc:
BindVimNav wires the standard vim-style navigation keys:
j/k for line movement, Ctrl-d/Ctrl-u for page, g/G for first/last.

methods.name: Checked
methods.doc: Checked sets the function to get the checked state for each item.

methods.name: Delete
methods.doc: Delete removes the currently selected item.

methods.name: Handle
methods.doc:
Handle registers a key binding that passes the currently selected item
to the callback. If nothing is selected, the callback is not called.

methods.name: Index
methods.doc: Index returns the current selection index.

methods.name: MarginTRBL
methods.signature: func (c *CheckListC[T]) MarginTRBL(t, r, b, l int16) *CheckListC[T]

methods.name: Marker
methods.doc: Marker sets the selection indicator.

methods.name: Marks
methods.doc: Marks sets the checkbox characters.

methods.name: Render
methods.doc: Render sets a custom render function for item content (after the checkbox).

methods.name: Selected
methods.doc: SelectedItem returns a pointer to the currently selected item.

types.name: CheckboxC
types.doc: CheckboxC is a toggleable checkbox bound to a *bool.

constructors.name: Checkbox
constructors.doc: Checkbox creates a checkbox bound to a bool pointer.

constructors.name: CheckboxPtr
constructors.doc: CheckboxPtr creates a checkbox with a dynamic label.

methods.name: Checked
methods.doc: Checked returns the current state.

methods.name: MarginTRBL
methods.signature: func (c *CheckboxC) MarginTRBL(t, r, b, l int16) *CheckboxC

methods.name: Toggle
methods.doc: Toggle flips the checked state.

types.name: ChildSize
types.doc: ChildSize represents a child's computed minimum dimensions.

types.name: Color
types.doc: Color represents a terminal color.

constructors.name: BasicColor
constructors.doc: BasicColor returns one of the 16 basic terminal colours.

constructors.name: DefaultColor
constructors.doc: DefaultColor returns the terminal's default color.

constructors.name: Hex
constructors.doc: Hex returns a 24-bit true color from a hex value (e.g., 0xFF5500).

constructors.name: LerpColor
constructors.doc: LerpColor blends between two colours. t=0 returns a, t=1 returns b.
constructors.signature: func LerpColor(a, b Color, t float64) Color

constructors.name: PaletteColor
constructors.doc: PaletteColor returns one of the 256 palette colours.

constructors.name: RGB
constructors.doc: RGB returns a 24-bit true color.
constructors.signature: func RGB(r, g, b uint8) Color

methods.name: Equal
methods.doc: Equal returns true if two colours are equal.

types.name: ColorMode
types.doc: ColorMode represents the color mode for a color value.
types.decl: type ColorMode uint8

types.name: ColumnConfig
types.doc: ColumnConfig holds rendering configuration for one column.

methods.name: Align
methods.doc: Align sets the column alignment.

methods.name: Format
methods.doc: Format sets a function that converts the field value to display text.

methods.name: Style
methods.doc: Style sets a function that returns a per-cell style based on the field value.

types.name: ColumnOption
types.doc: ColumnOption configures a single AutoTable column.
types.decl: type ColumnOption func(*ColumnConfig)

constructors.name: Bool
constructors.doc: Bool formats boolean values with custom labels.

constructors.name: Bytes
constructors.doc: Bytes formats numeric values as human-readable byte sizes.

constructors.name: Currency
constructors.doc:
Currency formats numeric values with a symbol prefix and comma
separators - it is by no means a full internationalization solution,
but it's a quick default.
constructors.signature: func Currency(symbol string, decimals int) ColumnOption

constructors.name: Number
constructors.doc:
Number formats numeric values with comma separators.
decimals controls decimal places for floats (ignored for integers).

constructors.name: Percent
constructors.doc: Percent formats numeric values as percentages.

constructors.name: PercentChange
constructors.doc: PercentChange formats numeric values as signed percentages with green/red coloring.

constructors.name: StyleBool
constructors.doc: StyleBool colors cells based on a boolean value.

constructors.name: StyleSign
constructors.doc: StyleSign colors cells based on the numeric sign of the value.

constructors.name: StyleThreshold
constructors.doc:
StyleThreshold colors cells based on numeric value thresholds.
Values < low get belowStyle, low..high get betweenStyle, > high get aboveStyle.
constructors.signature: func StyleThreshold(low, high float64, belowStyle, betweenStyle, aboveStyle Style) ColumnOption

types.name: Component
types.doc:
Component is the extension interface for custom components.
External packages can implement this to create custom components
that expand to built-in primitives at compile time.

types.name: Condition
types.doc:
Condition builder for type-safe conditionals.
The generic *T parameter enforces pointer-passing at compile time.

constructors.name: If
constructors.doc:
If starts a conditional chain. Compile-time enforces pointer:

	If(&state.Count).Eq(0)    // works
	If(state.Count).Eq(0)     // compile error: int is not *int

methods.name: Eq
methods.doc: Eq checks equality: *ptr == val

methods.name: Ne
methods.doc: Ne checks inequality: *ptr != val

methods.name: Then
methods.doc:
Then is shorthand for checking truthiness (not equal to zero value).
For bool: If(&flag).Then(node) renders when flag is true
For int: If(&count).Then(node) renders when count is non-zero
For string: If(&str).Then(node) renders when str is non-empty

types.name: ConditionEval
types.doc: ConditionEval holds a comparable condition ready for Then/Else

methods.name: Else
methods.doc: Else specifies what to render when false

methods.name: Then
methods.doc: Then specifies what to render when true

types.name: Cursor
types.doc:
Cursor represents a cursor position and style.
Use this to read full cursor state. For setting, use the individual
methods (SetCursor, SetCursorStyle, ShowCursor, HideCursor) which
are optimized for their typical usage patterns.

constructors.name: DefaultCursor
constructors.doc: DefaultCursor returns a cursor with sensible defaults.

types.name: CursorShape
types.doc: CursorShape represents the terminal cursor shape.
types.decl: type CursorShape int

consts.decl:
const (
	CursorDefault        CursorShape = 0 // Terminal default
	CursorBlockBlink     CursorShape = 1 // Blinking block
	CursorBlock          CursorShape = 2 // Steady block
	CursorUnderlineBlink CursorShape = 3 // Blinking underline
	CursorUnderline      CursorShape = 4 // Steady underline
	CursorBarBlink       CursorShape = 5 // Blinking bar (line)
	CursorBar            CursorShape = 6 // Steady bar (line)
)

types.name: Custom
types.doc:
Custom allows user-defined components without modifying the framework.
Use this for specialized widgets that aren't covered by built-in primitives.
Note: Custom components use function calls (not inlined like built-ins),
but with viewport culling this overhead is negligible.

constructors.name: Widget

types.name: ElseNode
types.doc: ElseNode renders when preceding If was false.

constructors.name: Else
constructors.doc: Else creates an else branch.

types.name: Filter
types.doc:
Filter provides fzf-style filtering mechanics for a slice of items.
it handles query parsing, scoring, filtering and index mapping back to the
original source slice. no UI opinions — bring your own rendering.

usage:

	f := NewFilter(&items, func(item *Item) string { return item.Name })
	f.Update("query")           // re-filter when query changes
	f.Items                     // filtered+ranked subset — point a ListC at &f.Items
	f.Original(selectedIndex)   // map filtered index back to source item

constructors.name: NewFilter
constructors.doc:
NewFilter creates a filter over a source slice.
extract returns the searchable text for each item.
constructors.signature: func NewFilter[T any](source *[]T, extract func(*T) string) *Filter[T]

methods.name: Active
methods.doc: Active reports whether a filter query is currently applied.

methods.name: Len
methods.doc: Len returns the number of currently visible (filtered) items.

methods.name: Original
methods.doc:
Original maps a filtered index back to a pointer into the source slice.
returns nil if the index is out of bounds.

methods.name: OriginalIndex
methods.doc:
OriginalIndex maps a filtered index back to the index in the source slice.
returns -1 if the index is out of bounds.

methods.name: Query

	email := Input().Placeholder("Email").ManagedBy(fm)

types.name: Layer
types.doc:
Layer is a pre-rendered buffer with scroll management.
Content is rendered once (expensive), then blitted to screen each frame (cheap).

If Render is set, the framework automatically calls it before blitting when
the viewport dimensions change. This ensures content is always rendered at
the correct size without manual timing coordination.

types.name: Op
types.doc: Op represents a single instruction.
types.decl:
type Op struct {
	Kind   OpKind
	Depth  int8  // tree depth (root children = 0)
	Parent int16 // parent op index, -1 for root children

	// Value access - one used based on Kind
	StaticStr string
	StrPtr    *string
	StrOff    uintptr // offset from element base (for ForEach)
	TextStyle Style   // style for text rendering

	StaticInt int
	IntPtr    *int
	IntOff    uintptr

	// Layout hints
	Width        int16   // explicit width
	Height       int16   // explicit height
	PercentWidth float32 // 0.0-1.0
	FlexGrow     float32 // share of remaining space
	Gap          int8    // gap between children
	ContentSized bool    // has fixed-width children (don't implicit flex)
	FitContent   bool    // size to content instead of filling available space

	// Container
	IsRow        bool        // true=HBox, false=VBox
	Border       BorderStyle // border style
	BorderFG     *Color      // border foreground color
	BorderBG     *Color      // border background color
	Title        string      // border title
	ChildStart   int16       // first child op index
	ChildEnd     int16       // last child op index (exclusive)
	CascadeStyle *Style      // style inherited by children (pointer for dynamic themes)
	Fill         Color       // container fill color (fills entire area)
	Margin       [4]int16    // outer margin: top, right, bottom, left

	// Control flow
	CondPtr  *bool         // for If (simple bool pointer)
	CondNode conditionNode // for If (builder-style conditions)
	ThenTmpl *Template     // for If
	ElseTmpl *Template     // for If/Else
	IterTmpl *Template     // for ForEach
	SlicePtr unsafe.Pointer
	ElemSize uintptr

	// Switch
	SwitchNode  switchNodeInterface
	SwitchCases []*Template
	SwitchDef   *Template

	// Custom renderer
	CustomRenderer Renderer

	// Custom layout
	CustomLayout LayoutFunc

	// Layer
	LayerPtr    *Layer // pointer to Layer
	LayerWidth  int16  // viewport width (0 = fill available)
	LayerHeight int16  // viewport height (0 = fill available)

	// RichText
	StaticSpans []Span  // for static spans
	SpansPtr    *[]Span // for pointer to spans
	SpansOff    uintptr // for ForEach offset

	// SelectionList
	SelectionListPtr *SelectionList // pointer to the list for len/offset updates
	SelectedPtr      *int           // pointer to selected index
	Marker           string         // selection marker (e.g., "> ")
	MarkerWidth      int16          // cached rune count of marker
	MarkerSpaces     string         // pre-computed spaces matching marker width

	// Leader
	LeaderLabel    string   // static label
	LeaderValue    string   // static value (OpLeader)
	LeaderValuePtr *string  // pointer value (OpLeaderPtr)
	LeaderIntPtr   *int     // pointer to int (OpLeaderIntPtr)
	LeaderFloatPtr *float64 // pointer to float64 (OpLeaderFloatPtr)
	LeaderFill     rune     // fill character (default '.')
	LeaderStyle    Style    // styling

	// Table
	TableColumns     []TableColumn // column definitions
	TableRowsPtr     *[][]string   // pointer to row data
	TableShowHeader  bool          // show header row
	TableHeaderStyle Style         // style for header
	TableRowStyle    Style         // style for rows
	TableAltStyle    Style         // alternating row style

	// AutoTable (reactive pointer-backed)
	AutoTableSlicePtr any                 // *[]T -- pointer to slice of structs
	AutoTableFields   []int               // field indices into the struct
	AutoTableHeaders  []string            // header labels
	AutoTableHdrStyle Style               // header style
	AutoTableRowStyle Style               // row style
	AutoTableAltStyle *Style              // alternating row style
	AutoTableGap      int8                // gap between columns
	AutoTableFill     Color               // row fill for alt rows
	AutoTableColCfgs  []*ColumnConfig     // per-column config (parallel to Fields, nil = no config)
	AutoTableSort     *autoTableSortState // nil unless sorting enabled
	AutoTableScroll   *autoTableScroll    // nil unless scrolling enabled

	// Sparkline
	SparkValues    []float64  // static values
	SparkValuesPtr *[]float64 // pointer values
	SparkMin       float64    // min value (0 = auto)
	SparkMax       float64    // max value (0 = auto)
	SparkStyle     Style      // styling

	// HRule/VRule
	RuleChar  rune  // line character
	RuleStyle Style // styling

	// Spinner
	SpinnerFramePtr *int     // pointer to frame index
	SpinnerFrames   []string // animation frames
	SpinnerStyle    Style    // styling

	// Scrollbar
	ScrollContentSize int   // total content size
	ScrollViewSize    int   // visible viewport size
	ScrollPosPtr      *int  // pointer to scroll position
	ScrollHorizontal  bool  // true for horizontal scrollbar
	ScrollTrackChar   rune  // track character
	ScrollThumbChar   rune  // thumb character
	ScrollTrackStyle  Style // track styling
	ScrollThumbStyle  Style // thumb styling

	// Tabs
	TabsLabels        []string  // tab labels
	TabsSelectedPtr   *int      // pointer to selected tab index
	TabsStyleType     TabsStyle // visual style
	TabsGap           int       // gap between tabs
	TabsActiveStyle   Style     // style for active tab
	TabsInactiveStyle Style     // style for inactive tabs

	// TreeView
	TreeRoot          *TreeNode // root node
	TreeShowRoot      bool      // whether to display root
	TreeIndent        int       // indentation per level
	TreeShowLines     bool      // show connecting lines
	TreeExpandedChar  rune      // expanded indicator
	TreeCollapsedChar rune      // collapsed indicator
	TreeLeafChar      rune      // leaf indicator
	TreeStyle         Style     // styling

	// Jump (jump target wrapper) - just marks a position, child is inline
	JumpOnSelect func() // callback when target is selected
	JumpStyle    Style  // label style override (zero = use app default)

	// TextInput
	TextInputFieldPtr       *InputState // Field-based API (bundles Value+Cursor)
	TextInputFocusGroupPtr  *FocusGroup // shared focus tracker
	TextInputFocusIndex     int         // this field's index in focus group
	TextInputValuePtr       *string     // bound text value (legacy)
	TextInputCursorPtr      *int        // bound cursor position (legacy)
	TextInputFocusedPtr     *bool       // show cursor only when true (legacy)
	TextInputPlaceholder    string      // placeholder text
	TextInputMask           rune        // password mask (0 = none)
	TextInputStyle          Style       // text style
	TextInputPlaceholderSty Style       // placeholder style
	TextInputCursorStyle    Style       // cursor style

	// Overlay
	OverlayCentered    bool      // center on screen
	OverlayX, OverlayY int16     // explicit position
	OverlayBackdrop    bool      // draw backdrop
	OverlayBackdropFG  Color     // backdrop color
	OverlayBG          Color     // background fill for overlay content area
	OverlayChildTmpl   *Template // compiled child content
	// contains filtered or unexported fields
}

types.name: Screen
types.doc: Screen manages the terminal display with double buffering and diff-based updates.

constructors.name: NewScreen
constructors.doc:
NewScreen creates a new screen writing to the given writer.
Pass nil to use os.Stdout.

methods.name: Buffer
methods.doc: Buffer returns the back buffer for drawing.

methods.name: BufferCursor
methods.doc:
BufferCursor writes cursor positioning and visibility to the internal buffer.
Call this before FlushBuffer() to batch cursor ops with content in one syscall.
methods.signature: func (s *Screen) BufferCursor(x, y int, visible bool, shape CursorShape)

methods.name: BufferCursorColor
methods.doc:
BufferCursorColor sets cursor color using OSC 12 escape sequence.
Format: OSC 12 ; #RRGGBB BEL

methods.name: Clear
methods.doc: Clear clears the back buffer.

methods.name: EnterInlineMode
methods.doc:
EnterInlineMode puts the terminal into raw mode WITHOUT alternate buffer.
Use this for inline UI elements (progress bars, menus, etc.) that render
in the normal terminal flow rather than taking over the screen.

methods.name: EnterRawMode
methods.doc: EnterRawMode puts the terminal into raw mode for TUI operation.

methods.name: ExitInlineMode
methods.doc:
ExitInlineMode restores the terminal from inline mode.
If clear is true, clears the lines used.
If clear is false, moves cursor below the rendered content.
methods.signature: func (s *Screen) ExitInlineMode(linesUsed int, clear bool) error

methods.name: ExitRawMode
methods.doc: ExitRawMode restores the terminal to its original state.

methods.name: Flush
methods.doc:
Flush renders the back buffer to the terminal using per-cell diff.
Only cells that actually changed are written, with cursor positioning for each run.
Uses dirty row tracking to skip rows that haven't been modified.

methods.name: FlushBuffer
methods.doc: FlushBuffer writes the accumulated buffer to the terminal in one syscall.

methods.name: FlushFull
methods.doc: FlushFull does a complete redraw without diffing.

methods.name: FlushInline
methods.doc:
FlushInline renders the buffer for inline mode (no alternate screen).
Renders at current cursor position using relative movement.
Returns the number of lines rendered for cleanup tracking.

types.name: SelectionList
types.doc:
SelectionList displays a list of items with selection marker.
Items must be a pointer to a slice (*[]T).
Selected must be a pointer to an int (*int) tracking the selected index.
Render is optional - if nil, items are rendered using fmt.Sprintf("%v", item).
Marker defaults to "> " if not specified.
types.decl:
type SelectionList struct {
	Items         any    // *[]T - pointer to slice of items
	Selected      *int   // pointer to selected index
	Marker        string // selection marker (default "> ", use " " for no visible marker)
	MarkerStyle   Style  // style for marker text (merged with SelectedStyle.BG for selected rows)
	Render        any    // func(*T) any - optional, renders each item
	MaxVisible    int    // max items to show (0 = all)
	Style         Style  // default style for non-selected rows (e.g., background)
	SelectedStyle Style  // style for selected row (e.g., background color)
	// contains filtered or unexported fields
}

types.name: SpacerNode
types.doc:
SpacerNode creates empty space with specified dimensions.
If no dimensions are set, Spacer grows to fill available space (implicit Grow(1)).
With explicit Width/Height, it becomes a fixed-size spacer.

Examples:
  - Spacer{}              → fills available space (grows)
  - Spacer{Height: 1}     → fixed 1-line vertical gap
  - Spacer{Width: 10}     → fixed 10-char horizontal gap
  - Spacer{}.Grow(2)      → grows with weight 2
  - Spacer{Char: '.'}     → dotted leader (fills with dots)

type TextInput struct {
	// Field-based API (recommended for forms)
	Field      *InputState // Bundles Value + Cursor in one struct
	FocusGroup *FocusGroup // Shared focus tracker - cursor shows when FocusGroup.Current == FocusIndex
	FocusIndex int         // This field's index in the focus group

	// Pointer-based API (for single fields)
	Value   *string // Bound text value (ignored if Field is set)
	Cursor  *int    // Cursor position (ignored if Field is set)
	Focused *bool   // Show cursor only when true (ignored if FocusGroup is set)

	// Common options
	Placeholder      string // Shown when value is empty
	Width            int    // Field width (0 = fill available)
	Mask             rune   // Password mask character (0 = none)
	Style            Style  // Text style
	PlaceholderStyle Style  // Placeholder style (zero = dim text)
	CursorStyle      Style  // Cursor style (zero = reverse video)
}

types.name: VRuleNode
types.doc:
VRuleNode draws a vertical line that fills available height.
Default character is '│' (box drawing light vertical).

types.name: VerticalLayout
types.doc: VerticalLayout stacks children vertically.

types.name: ViewBuilder
types.doc: ViewBuilder allows chaining Handle() calls after View().

methods.name: Handle
methods.doc:
Handle registers a key handler for this view.
Accepts func(riffkey.Match), func(any), or func() for convenience.
Automatically requests a re-render after the handler runs.

methods.name: NoCounts
methods.doc:
NoCounts disables vim-style count prefixes (e.g., 5j) for this view.
Use this when the view has text input so digits can be typed.

funcs.name: Arrange
funcs.doc:
Arrange creates a container with a custom layout function.
The layout function receives child sizes and available space, returns positions.

	Arrange(Grid(3, 20, 5))(
	    Text("A"), Text("B"), Text("C"),
	    Text("D"), Text("E"), Text("F"),
	)

funcs.name: Define
GenerateLabels
funcs.doc:
GenerateLabels creates n unique labels for jump targets.
For small sets (<=27): single chars (a, s, d, f, ...)
For larger sets: two chars (aa, as, ad, ...)

funcs.name: LED
funcs.doc: LED returns a single LED indicator: ● (on) or ○ (off)

funcs.name: LeaderDash
funcs.signature: func LeaderDash(label, value string, width int) string

funcs.name: LeaderStr
funcs.doc:
LeaderStr creates a dot-leader string: "LABEL...........VALUE"
Width is the total width including label and value.
Deprecated: Use the Leader component for pointer binding support.
funcs.signature: func LeaderStr(label, value string, width int) string

funcs.name: Meter
funcs.signature: func Meter(value, max, width int) string

funcs.name: TimingString
funcs.doc: TimingString returns a formatted timing string.

consts.decl:
const (
	BoxHorizontal         = '─'
	BoxVertical           = '│'
	BoxTopLeft            = '┌'
	BoxTopRight           = '┐'
	BoxBottomLeft         = '└'
	BoxBottomRight        = '┘'
	BoxRoundedTopLeft     = '╭'
	BoxRoundedTopRight    = '╮'
	BoxRoundedBottomLeft  = '╰'
	BoxRoundedBottomRight = '╯'
	BoxDoubleHorizontal   = '═'
	BoxDoubleVertical     = '║'
	BoxDoubleTopLeft      = '╔'
	BoxDoubleTopRight     = '╗'
	BoxDoubleBottomLeft   = '╚'
	BoxDoubleBottomRight  = '╝'
)

consts.doc: Box junction characters for merged borders
consts.decl:
const (
	BoxTeeDown  = '┬' // ─ meets │ from below
	BoxTeeUp    = '┴' // ─ meets │ from above
	BoxTeeRight = '├' // │ meets ─ from right
	BoxTeeLeft  = '┤' // │ meets ─ from left
	BoxCross    = '┼' // all four directions
)

vars.decl:
var (
	Black   = BasicColor(0)
	Red     = BasicColor(1)
	Green   = BasicColor(2)
	Yellow  = BasicColor(3)
	Blue    = BasicColor(4)
	Magenta = BasicColor(5)
	Cyan    = BasicColor(6)
	White   = BasicColor(7)

	// Bright variants
	BrightBlack   = BasicColor(8)
	BrightRed     = BasicColor(9)
	BrightGreen   = BasicColor(10)
	BrightYellow  = BasicColor(11)
	BrightBlue    = BasicColor(12)
	BrightMagenta = BasicColor(13)
	BrightCyan    = BasicColor(14)
	BrightWhite   = BasicColor(15)
)

vars.doc: DefaultJumpStyle is the default styling for jump labels.
SpinnerBraille is the default spinner animation (braille dots).
SpinnerDots is a simple dot spinner.
ThemeDark is a dark theme with light text on dark background.
vars.decl:
var ThemeDark = ThemeEx{
	Base:   Style{FG: White},
	Muted:  Style{FG: BrightBlack},
	Accent: Style{FG: BrightCyan},
	Error:  Style{FG: BrightRed},
	Border: Style{FG: BrightBlack},
}

vars.doc: ThemeLight is a light theme with dark text on light background.
vars.decl:
var ThemeLight = ThemeEx{
	Base:   Style{FG: Black},
	Muted:  Style{FG: BrightBlack},
	Accent: Style{FG: Blue},
	Error:  Style{FG: Red},
	Border: Style{FG: White},
}

vars.doc: ThemeMonochrome is a minimal theme using only attributes.
vars.decl:
var ThemeMonochrome = ThemeEx{
	Base:   Style{},
	Muted:  Style{Attr: AttrDim},
	Accent: Style{Attr: AttrBold},
	Error:  Style{Attr: AttrBold | AttrUnderline},
	Border: Style{Attr: AttrDim},
}
